Member.Name: Unit
Member.Description: Unit of measure of the parameter

AddOnInstructionDefinition.Name: IA_SENSOR
AddOnInstructionDefinition.AdditionalHelpText:
This addon instruction scales an analog input from a sensor.
InRawMax, default: 16383 (20mA) InRawMin, default: 3277(4mA)
InEUMax, max sensor value InEUmin, min sensor value
RawSensorValue, this is the sensor analog input
MODULE_ENABLE, this enables the module.
SIMULATIE_ENABLE, if this is set to (TRUE/1) the scaling will be ignored and the OUTPUT will be the same as SIMULATIE_VALUE

Parameter.Name: EnableIn
Parameter.Description: Enable Input - System Defined Parameter

Parameter.Name: EnableOut
Parameter.Description: Enable Output - System Defined Parameter

Parameter.Name: InRawMax
Parameter.Description: MAX analog value

Parameter.Name: InRawMin
Parameter.Description: MIN analog value

Parameter.Name: InEUMax
Parameter.Description: MAX scaled value

Parameter.Name: InEUMin
Parameter.Description: MIN scaled value

Parameter.Name: RawSensorValue
Parameter.Description: raw sensor value

Parameter.Name: MODULE_ENABLE
Parameter.Description: TURNS ON THE MODULE

Parameter.Name: SIMULATIE_ENABLE
Parameter.Description: Turns on the simulation and ignores the RawSensorValue

Parameter.Name: SIMULATIE_VALUE
Parameter.Description: Simulation value (make sure it is in the same range to achieve best preformance)

Parameter.Name: OUTPUT
Parameter.Description: Live Output value from the addon

Block.VisiblePins: EnableIn In InRawMax InRawMin InEUMax InEUMin Out

Parameter.Name: EnableIn
Parameter.Description: Enable Input - System Defined Parameter

Parameter.Name: EnableOut
Parameter.Description: Enable Output - System Defined Parameter

Parameter.Name: Alarm
Parameter.Description: once outputvalue is not within alarmvalue low and high

Parameter.Name: AlarmValue_HIGH
Parameter.Description: highest alarm value, based on scaled_max

Parameter.Name: AlarmValue_LOW
Parameter.Description: lowest alarm value based on scaled min

Parameter.Name: InRawMax
Parameter.Description: highest measurable value

Parameter.Name: inRawMin
Parameter.Description: Lowest measurable value

Parameter.Name: Scaled_Max
Parameter.Description: used defined Highest value (Temperature, pressure, etc)

Parameter.Name: Scaled_Min
Parameter.Description: used defined lowest value (Temperature, pressure, etc)

Parameter.Name: RawSensorValue
Parameter.Description: Sensor input from point IO card

Parameter.Name: OutputValue
Parameter.Description: scaled value

Parameter.Name: cnf_Set_100
Parameter.Description: Set inrawmax at current raw value

Parameter.Name: cnf_Set_0
Parameter.Description: Set inrawmin at current raw value

Parameter.Name: reset
Parameter.Description: Reset the alarm if alarm was true

Parameter.Name: cnf_Use_MovingAvg
Parameter.Description: 0 = no moving avg 1 = use moving avg

Parameter.Name: MovingAvgNumberOfSamples
Parameter.Description: Set size of moving avg, can never be larger then array size

Parameter.Name: MovingAvgSampleRate
Parameter.Description: in ms

Parameter.Name: Simulation
Parameter.Description: Set to true to bypass input rawvalue and use simulationvalue

Parameter.Name: SimulationValue
Parameter.Description: Value to use for sensor once simulation is set to true

STContent.Line: #region connect input values to local addon
#region Check if value is between alarm values
/* for example alarmvalue_high is 10 & alarmvalue_low is 5. */
#region set sample rate of moving avg.
if MovingAvgSampleRate=0 then // no sample rate is set, this means the scantime of the PLC is the sample rate.
MovingAvg.In:=HMI_Sensor.OUTPUT; // Sensor output is the moving avg input.
else // Samplerate is set, so the input is based on the timer input
T_MovingAvg.PRE:=MovingAvgSampleRate; // Timer pre is set by user.
if T_MovingAvg.DN then // once timer is done,set copy the inputvalue to the moving avg input.
MovingAvg.In:=HMI_Sensor.OUTPUT; // Sensor output is the moving avg input.
if HMI_Sensor.MODULE_ENABLE AND NOT Alarm then
SIZE(StorageArrayMovingAvg,0,wrk_arraySize); // get array size, so num of samples can never be larger.
if MovingAvgNumberOfSamples > wrk_arraySize then MovingAvgNumberOfSamples:=wrk_arraySize; end_if; // prevent controller faulted
/* if interval is set, then look at timer done */
/* if interval is not set, then bypass timer */
OutputValue:=MovingAvg.Out; // Copy moving avg output to addon output.
OutputValue:=HMI_Sensor.OUTPUT; // if there is an alarm in the value, move the real value to the output of the sensor addon.
OutputValue:=HMI_Sensor.OUTPUT; // cnf_Use_MovingAvg is not set, so use the real value form the sensor to output.(bypass moving avg)
InRawMax:=HMI_Sensor.RawSensorValue; // copy rawvalue to highest value point
cnf_Set_100:=0; // set signal back to false, only run once on user input.
inRawMin:=HMI_Sensor.RawSensorValue; // copy rawvalue to lowest value point
cnf_Set_0:=0; // set signal back to false, only run once on user input.
// in scale both can never be the same, only if not valid input OR if user forgot to fillin data. lets take care of that :)
// in scale both can never be the same, only if not valid input OR if user forgot to fillin data. lets take care of that :)
// in scale both can never be the same, only if not valid input OR if user forgot to fillin data. lets take care of that :)
